pullRequest.body:
Define `class` of an ideal lies over an ideal.

Co-authored-by: Yongle Hu @mbkybky
Co-authored-by: Jiedong Jiang @jjdishere

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [99d56098ec](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17415/commits/99d56098ec0c29c5007fbc6fce8f8f8c4d1ed1ab)

|-|-|

</details>

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b0c6a460-9d4f-444e-a426-ea9f0fb78ed0) for commit cdb8298e2732c13105957c977c18a22191dab595.Found no runs to compare against.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b6a987e8-8d37-4c83-9d15-256763d8b0ff) for commit 3b980a479de97e5787b343c4816d6e305c1179e1.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/e3729b6e-082a-42cb-bc12-54d80fb780f7/to/b6a987e8-8d37-4c83-9d15-256763d8b0ff) against commit 81e65433ee271e679931bc2674586fce8fd5db8e:
```diff
  Benchmark                        Metric         Change
  ======================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Ideal.Over   instructions    27.4%
```

LGTM
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Can you clarify the status of the discussion about `over_isMaximal` above?

Also, I'm finding it hard to parse the title of this PR.
`over_isMaximal` is removed

I think this is an interesting idea, and I can believe that it will make some arguments for Frobenius elements easier too. Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11419883292/job/31774959032)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11419883292/job/31774958974)

> I think this is an interesting idea, and I can believe that it will make some arguments for Frobenius elements easier too. Thanks!

I removed `over_isMaximal` because, as Andrew Yang pointed out, it would cause misunderstandings for others. Such a definition would only be used in specific contexts. I think when constructing some particular structures like ramificationIdx in the Galois case or the Frob element, maybe we can privately make such an auxiliary definition to help us with the construction. Then others will not directly use this definition.

Thanks for the contribution!
Some suggestions:

The naming convention requires classes to be in `PascalCase`, i.e. `IdealLiesOver` in this case. I would suggest `Ideal.LiesOver` instead so that you could write `P.LiesOver p` so that you wouldn't need the infix.
Also please read the rest of [this guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) and change the lemma names below accordingly.
I'm not entirely convinced that this is needed.
I think that writing `comap (algebraMap A B) P` is too verbose, especially when the forms of `A` and `B` are quite complex. So I wrote this abbreviation.
Fair enough. I like this in principle, but I'm a bit afraid if some automation wouldn't like it. Let's keep it for now.

```suggestion
  IsScalarTower.of_algebraMap_eq' rfl
```

```suggestion
/-- If `B` is integral over `A`, for any maximal ideal `p` in `A`,
there exists a maximal ideal in `B` lying over `p`. -/
```
I wonder what you need this for?

I came up with this definition while writing about Galois extensions of number fields. 
Let `K / L` be a Galois extension of number fields, and let `p` be a maximal ideal of `𝓞 K`. Initially, I defined the ramification index of `p` as `ramificationIdx (algebraMap (𝓞 K) (𝓞 L)) p P`, where `P` is a maximal ideal over `p` selected using `exists_ideal_over_maximal_of_isIntegral`. However, when I was proving that it is equal to the ramification index corresponding to any other ideal `P'`, I had to repeatedly prove the existence of `P` and then use `choose_spec` to obtain the corresponding property. 
Therefore, I wanted to use this definition to simplify my previous proof.

You should prove that `ramificationIdx (algebraMap (𝓞 K) (𝓞 L)) p P = ramificationIdx (algebraMap (𝓞 K) (𝓞 L)) p P'` for all `P` and `P'` by some transitivity argument and the lemma you mentioned is then just a simple application of this.
Also see how this was done in [flt-regular](https://github.com/leanprover-community/flt-regular/blob/82763ff91a32d6ab0e194eb44e05b02fb8aa361b/FltRegular/NumberTheory/GaloisPrime.lean#L225-L282). 

I feel like this definition is very non-canonical and could mislead other people into providing weaker statements later on and I'd suggest we avoid it unless it gives a significant improvement.

I'm not a fan of shadowing variables. Is it possible to split them into sections?
That is,
```lean
section Semiring
variable {A} [Semiring A]
-- stuff
end Semiring

section Ring
variable {A} [Ring A]
-- stuff
end Ring
```
Also the order of the arguments of the ideals is different from the def. Maybe reverse it here?
You should have some lemma saying `Ideal.under A (Ideal.under B 𝔓) = Ideal.under A 𝔓` and this is probably then unnecessary.

```suggestion
  over : p = Ideal.under A P
```
The design of class arguments is that you should in general avoid referring to the arguments themselves. So these should be unnamed and rewrite with `LiesOver.over 𝔓 P` or something similar.
Should this be moved to the commring section?
Do you think `P.under A` looks better than `Ideal.under A P`?

```suggestion
variable {A : Type*} [CommSemiring A] {B : Type*} [CommSemiring B] {C : Type*} [Semiring C]
```
Please include the integrality assumption in the docstring.

```suggestion
theorem of_ker_algebraMap_eq_bot (R A : Type*) [CommRing R] [Semiring A] [Algebra R A]
```
same below

```suggestion
theorem iff_algebraMap_ker_eq_bot {R A : Type*} [CommRing R] [Ring A] [IsDomain A] [Algebra R A] :
```
We prefer implicit arguments for iffs if the variable appears on both sides, since it can usually be inferred anyways.
These should be `ker_algebraMap` as well.
Can you add a lemma/instance saying that the algebra map is injective & it is `NoZeroSMulDivisors`.

```suggestion
example [Module.Finite A B] : Module.Finite (A ⧸ P.under A) (B ⧸ P) := inferInstance
```
Maybe? (maybe needs parentheses)
Can you merge this with `isNoetherian_quotient`?
I don't think this belongs here.
I don't find a suitable place to put it because it requires importing files related to both `Algebra.FiniteType` and the quotient of rings at the same time.
I think it is fine to import ideal quotients in the `Algebra.FiniteType` file.
You might want this for every `R` such that `IsScalarTower R A B`.
Is `Mathlib/RingTheory/Ideal/Quotient.lean` not enough?
No. It requires the instance `Algebra R (S ⧸ I)`.
Okay fair enough.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Ideal/Over): define a class for an ideal lying over an ideal
